reviewText: Grab Your Cheese Balls,Sit back And watch,Its Not as You rememeber It,Its A Fair Movie At that,Has A Memorable cast in It From Other Shows.
I thought this was such a cute movie when it came out, I just had to add it to my DVD collection.  John Dye is just adorable

The movie is a comedy/Thriller non horror movie, When i say non horror thriller, another words you wonder what is going to happen next. The movie is about a college student who needs to come up with $10,000 in 30 days for tution or he will be thrown out of college. He comes up with an idea to make a Sports pin up calander with college boys on it. He borrows $12,000 from a loan shark to start his project but with a %30 interest rate. He has to come up with $25,600 in 30 days OR ELSE.

Campus Man is a guilty pleasure with Brett Wilson and Cactus Jack providing all the eye candy a film might need. Why do millions of viewers watch the men's diving competition every four years? Fit young men making a splash (or as little as possible) in the pool is the easy answer.

The fictional diver Brett Wilson has the looks and form to deliver every time you put Campus Man in your DVD player.
It was a very entertaining movie.
On of my favorite movies growing up.  Highly recommend!
NOT GREAT, BUT A FRIEND OF MINE HAS A PART.

This was a movie that I had seen a long time ago and actually had it in VHS. I have steadily been replacing my old VHS tapes with DVD"s. Campus Man was one that I had been looking for and fortunately found thru Amazon.  I am a fan of sports related movies and enjoyed this one very much.
SUPRISE! THERES MORE THAN ONE GOOD LOOKING MAN IN HERE. STORYLINE IS GOOD TOO.
I was pleased and the item was well received. Thank you.

Nothing spectacular about this movie, but brings back memories because I was an extra in it during my sophomore year at ASU (only $35 for 12 hours of sitting around). I think I'm in the first scene -- wearing a sweater when I think it was supposed to be summer (they shot it over December break). My buddy actually got a more prominent role -- he's one of the computer nerds (think he's wearing one of those fisherman style hats) who gets arrested. My other buddy was annoyed that his boss at the bookstore got a speaking part -- and then he was happy when they dubbed over the guy's high pitched voice with a more manly voice.

Anyway, cheesy 80s teen fare with a predictable story that is, however, loosely based on a real story. The guy who came up with story was an ASU student who produced a beefcake calendar featuring the ASU dive team -- I think it was one of the 1st popular male calendars.

John Dye (R.I.P.) was in the scene I was an extra in and I was glad when he got a decent role on TV.
I liked the movie. I received the movie on time. The movie remind me of the 80's. It was Great.
